channel.title: Need help, easy fix but i cant +++++REP
channel.description:
[b][size=10pt]using delta source, help would be appreciated, do not tell me to change sources because i wont no matter what, dont post anything unless its helping me.[/size][/b]
my error: [code] client.java:16037: error: cannot find symbol actionTimer = 10; ^ symbol: variable actionTimer location: class client 1 error[/code]
How do i make an actionTimer for delta? Where the fuck is the variable? I tried searching it in allstar and nothing was found in the client.java
You know how allstar sources would have something like: [code] actionTimer = 10; [/code] or [code]if (actionTimer > 0) { actionTimer -= 1; }[/code]

item.title: Need help, easy fix but i cant +++++REP
item.dc:creator: @weeddamn weeddamn
item.description:
@weeddamn wrote:

LOL thanks i forgot derp

item.title: Need help, easy fix but i cant +++++REP
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

Yeah you can’t just add the variable and expect it to work, you have to implement it within your code and how you want it to work…

if (actionTimer > 0) {
return;
}

The two things included in your first post also are needed.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help, easy fix but i cant +++++REP

item.title: Need help, easy fix but i cant +++++REP
item.dc:creator: @weeddamn weeddamn
item.description:
@weeddamn wrote:

I got no errors, but it doesn’t stop mass clicking aka fast clicking. when you click an object there is no timer or delay or whatever you want to call it. I need a timer that works. Were you cant click an object and get cash for it every millisecond u click.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help, easy fix but i cant +++++REP
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

Can’t find the variable actionTimer in the Client class.

You need to create it.

public int actionTimer;

But I’m sure it’s there somewhere, it might be called something different.

Anyways, if it doesn’t you’re going the right way about it.

Read full topic
